com.esri.mo2.ui.bean
Interface LayerHandler

Deprecated. - the class has been deprecated, please consult the classes in the com.esri.mo2.ui.cat packages.

public interface LayerHandler

Provides a way to add Layer types to the DatasetEditor of the Layer bean.

Method Summary

          Deprecated. Returns a JComponent that can be used by a CustomDatasetEditor.

          Deprecated. Returns the underlying Layer that can be added to a Map.
 String getName()
          Deprecated. Returns a name to be shown in the IDE's tabbed display.
 

Method Detail

getLayer

public Layer getLayer(String details)
               throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Returns the underlying Layer that can be added to a Map. This method will normally interpret the String parameter as connection information. It will then connect with the LayerSource and obtain the appropriate Layer.

Parameters:
details - information needed to access various data sources. See Layer.setDataset for the content and format of this string.
Throws:
IOException
See Also:
Layer.setDataset(String details)

getCustomDatasetEditor

public JComponent getCustomDatasetEditor()
Deprecated. 
Returns a JComponent that can be used by a CustomDatasetEditor. The purpose of this component is to prepare a "Dataset details" String that will modify a Layer's Dataset property, and will eventually be used by the getLayer method within this interface.

This JComponent calls its putClientProperty method when the Dataset details have been chosen by the end-user, using the key "new". It is also expected to respond to a PropertyChangeEvent having the key "set", that is signalled when the IDE sets the property value into the user interface.

See Also:
getLayer(java.lang.String)

getName

public String getName()
Deprecated. 
Returns a name to be shown in the IDE's tabbed display.
